title: Yashasvi Jaiswal available to play Ranji Trophy for Mumbai - The Indian Express
summary:
Yashasvi Jaiswal Available for Ranji Trophy with Mumbai

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India Test opener Yashasvi Jaiswal has confirmed his availability for Mumbai's upcoming Ranji Trophy match against Jammu and Kashmir.

  • Jaiswal performed well in the Australian tour, scoring a century and a half century.
  • He will participate in the practice session at Wankhede Stadium on Wednesday.
  • Mumbai's coach Omkar Salvi has been informed about his availability.
  • Sarfaraz Khan will miss the next match due to a rib injury.
  • Rohit Sharma's availability for selection is pending.
“Domestic cricket forms the backbone of Indian cricket and serves as the feeder line to Team India.” - Jay Shah

The return of Jaiswal boosts Mumbai's chances in the Ranji Trophy, especially in light of Sarfaraz Khan's injury.
newTitle: Yashasvi Jaiswal Available for Ranji Trophy with Mumbai

title: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli back in Ranji Trophy? Here's last time Indian players hit domestic pitch - The Times of India
Manu Bhaker's Paris Olympics medals to be replaced after IOC's big announcement - Hindustan Times
summary:
IOC to Replace Defective Medals from Paris Olympics, Manu Bhaker to Get Her Medals Replaced

Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The International Olympic Committee has announced that defective medals from the 2024 Paris Olympics will be replaced. Indian shooter Manu Bhaker has expressed her desire to have her bronze medals replaced as well.

  • The IOC stated the replacement process for defective medals will begin shortly.
  • Manu Bhaker won a bronze in the women’s individual 10m air pistol event and is the first Indian woman shooter to win an Olympic medal.
  • Bhaker also secured another bronze in the Mixed Team event with Sarabjot Singh.
  • The Monnaie de Paris is in charge of assessing any complaints and replacing medals.
“Yes, I read about it today. If they are replacing, then yes, I would like to get mine also replaced.” – Manu Bhaker

The IOC is working closely with the Monnaie de Paris to ensure a systematic replacement of the medals.
newTitle: IOC to Replace Defective Medals from Paris Olympics, Manu Bhaker to Get Her Medals Replaced

title: 'Chappell way won't work': BCCI to rethink head coach Gautam Gambhir's future based on Champions Trophy... - Moneycontrol
summary:
'Chappell way won't work': BCCI to rethink head coach Gautam Gambhir's future based on Champions Trophy performance

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The BCCI is contemplating the future of head coach Gautam Gambhir, depending on India's performance in the Champions Trophy. A senior BCCI source indicated that Gambhir's position could be at risk if India performs poorly.

  • The decision regarding Gambhir's future is heavily tied to the outcome of the Champions Trophy.
  • A poor performance could make his position untenable.
“The head coach's position could become untenable if India puts up a dismal show in the Champions Trophy.”

The stakes are high for Gambhir, as the upcoming tournament could be pivotal for his coaching career.
newTitle: 'Chappell way won't work': BCCI to rethink head coach Gautam Gambhir's future based on Champions Trophy performance

title: Euro giants make ‘unstoppable’ Man Utd star their priority as crunch agent meeting is scheduled for Wednesday - Stretty News
summary:
AC Milan Targets Marcus Rashford Amidst Transfer Interest

Publication Date: January 13, 2025   Source: Stretty News

AC Milan is reportedly leading the race to secure the signing of Marcus Rashford from Manchester United as the forward remains sidelined from competitive play.

  • Rashford has not played in a competitive match for over a month, with uncertainty regarding his future at Manchester United.
  • Besides AC Milan, clubs like Barcelona, Borussia Dortmund, and Juventus are also interested, but only Milan has made formal moves.
  • Rashford's agent held discussions in Italy, with a crucial meeting scheduled for Wednesday to finalize potential transfer details.
“He is a player for Manchester United. He loves this club, but I have to make choices. It is what it is.”

The situation indicates a pivotal moment in Rashford's career as clubs express keen interest in acquiring his services amidst his current standing at United.
newTitle: AC Milan Targets Marcus Rashford Amidst Transfer Interest

title: Araujo: Laporta makes Barcelona transfer stance clear amid Juventus talks - Football Italia
summary:
Laporta Clarifies Barcelona's Intentions to Keep Araujo Amid Juventus Interest

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Marca

Barcelona President Joan Laporta has made it clear that the club intends to retain defender Ronald Araujo, who is currently in discussions with club officials following an offer from Juventus.

  • Barcelona is keen to persuade Araujo to remain at the club despite interest from Juventus.
  • Araujo’s contract lasts until 2026, but negotiations regarding a new deal have stalled.
  • Juventus are searching for a new centre-back to replace the injured Gleison Bremer.
  • Laporta emphasized the positive relationship between the club and Araujo, stating they appreciate him both personally and professionally.
“We want our players to be helpful and to stay with us. He has a contract, and we want him to stay.” - Joan Laporta

This situation highlights Barcelona's commitment to keeping key players as they navigate transfer discussions in challenging times.
newTitle: Laporta Clarifies Barcelona's Intentions to Keep Araujo Amid Juventus Interest

title: David, Wade push Hurricanes to the top, end Renegades' playoffs hopes - ESPNcricinfo
Ajit Agarkar told 'Virat Kohli past his best', asked to find 'new Tendulkar, Dravid'; Gautam Gambhir will 'have big say' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajit Agarkar told 'Virat Kohli past his best', asked to find 'new Tendulkar, Dravid'; Gautam Gambhir will 'have big say'

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Amid a troubling period for Indian cricket, former English cricketer David Lloyd has stated that Virat Kohli's best days are behind him and emphasized the need for the BCCI to identify new talent similar to legends Tendulkar and Dravid.

  • India recently lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.
  • Kohli's performance in 2024 was notably poor, with just 414 runs.
  • Lloyd believes Kohli is struggling with age and should not bat at No. 4.
  • He suggests investing in young cricketers to build a strong future team.
"Virat Kohli knows he is past his best and that will hurt... Your reflexes gently go." - David Lloyd

It is crucial for the BCCI to reassess their strategy and consider including emerging players to ensure the team's long-term success.
newTitle: Ajit Agarkar Urges BCCI to Find New Cricket Talents Amid Kohli's Struggles

summary:
Sanju Samson Unlikely To Be Part Of India's Champions Trophy 2025 Squad: Reports

Last Updated: January 14, 2025, 18:47 IST

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) selectors are set to meet in Mumbai on January 19 to pick India’s squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Reports suggest that Sanju Samson is unlikely to be selected in the squad, with competition from other wicketkeepers.

  • Sanju Samson has scored 510 runs in 16 ODI matches.
  • He last played a 50-over match against South Africa, scoring a century.
  • KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant are expected to be preferred as wicketkeepers in the squad.
  • There is a three-way competition for the backup position between Dhruv Jurel, Ishan Kishan, and Samson.
“Samson’s chances of making the cut are very slim after he decided to skip the Vijay Hazare Trophy for personal reasons.”

Overall, it seems that Samson may be sidelined in favor of others as India prepares for the tournament.
newTitle: Sanju Samson Unlikely To Be Part Of India's Champions Trophy 2025 Squad: Reports

'Sachin ko bolo' - Yograj Singh reveals why Arjun Tendulkar stopped training under him - CricTracker
summary:
'Sachin ko bolo' - Yograj Singh reveals why Arjun Tendulkar stopped training under him

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CricTracker

Yograj Singh explains the reason why Arjun Tendulkar ceased his training under him following his IPL selection, citing concerns about his reputation being linked to Arjun's success.

  • Yograj Singh is the father of Yuvraj Singh and was training Arjun for 12 days in 2022.
  • During training, Arjun made his First-Class debut and scored a century, which helped him secure a contract with the Mumbai Indians.
  • Arjun's decision not to continue training under Yograj stemmed from apprehensions about reputational concerns.
  • Yograj expressed his disappointment and suggested that Yuvraj ask Sachin to let Arjun train with him for a year.
  • Arjun has played 17 First-Class matches and has had variable performances in the IPL.
"When he scored a hundred on debut and then returned to IPL, then people were afraid, what if his (Arjun's) name gets stuck with me?" - Yograj Singh

This situation highlights the challenges faced by young athletes in balancing mentorship and personal success in a competitive environment.
newTitle: 'Sachin ko bolo' - Yograj Singh reveals why Arjun Tendulkar stopped training under him

In the upcoming match of the T20 tournament, Durban's Super Giants (DSG) will clash with Joburg Super Kings (JSK) in match 8 of the SA20 league at Kingsmead, Durban.

summary:
Saqib Mahmood's Visa Delay Affects England's Preparations for India Tour

Date: October 2023 Source: ESPN Cricinfo

England cricketer Saqib Mahmood faces challenges in joining his team for their tour to India due to delays in securing his visa.

  • Mahmood missed a training camp in Abu Dhabi due to the visa delay.
  • The ECB is optimistic that he will secure his visa in time for the team's departure to Kolkata.
  • This visa delay reflects ongoing issues faced by England players of Pakistani descent.

  • He has had previous visa issues that have affected his international play.
“The ECB declined to comment but is understood to be optimistic that Mahmood will secure his visa in time.”

This incident highlights the recurring hurdles faced by players with specific heritage, potentially affecting team dynamics and performance on an international stage.

summary:
Rift Between Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir, Ajit Agarkar? BCCI Breaks Silence On Rumours

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

The BCCI has confirmed the announcement date for the ICC Champions Trophy squad while dismissing rumors of rifts among key cricket figures amidst their recent performance issues.

  • The squad for the ICC Champions Trophy will be announced on February 18 or 19.
  • India will compete in the tournament hosted by Pakistan and UAE from February 19 to March 9.
  • Key matches include a face-off against Pakistan on February 23.
  • BCCI's Rajeev Shukla refuted claims of discord between Ajit Agarkar, Gautam Gambhir, and Rohit Sharma.
  • Recent poor performances by Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were acknowledged as part of the sport's ebbs and flows.
  • The Kho Kho World Cup has also started in New Delhi, featuring multiple countries.
“Completely wrong statement to be made. No rift between coach, selection chairman, coach and captain.” - Rajeev Shukla

The BCCI's efforts to clarify rumors are crucial as they prepare for an important cricketing season that places them under significant scrutiny.
newTitle: BCCI Addresses Rumors of Rift Between Cricket Officials and Players

summary:
Asked About Yograj Singh's "Wanted To Shoot Him" Statement, Kapil Dev Gives Epic Reply

Publication Date: January 14, 2025

Source: NDTV

The article discusses a recent podcast where former cricketer Yograj Singh revealed an alarming incident involving Kapil Dev. Yograj claimed he threatened Kapil with a gun after feeling wronged by being dropped from the domestic team. Kapil's humorous and dismissive response to the controversy caught public attention.

  • Yograj Singh revealed he went to Kapil Dev's house with a gun.
  • He expressed mercy after seeing Kapil's mother.
  • Kapil Dev humorously pretended not to know Yograj during a recent press interaction.
  • Yograj shared details of his emotional confrontation with Kapil during a podcast.
Kapil Dev said, "Yograj Singh kon hai?"

This unexpected incident highlights tensions in the cricket community, even as it elicits amusement from fans. Kapil's lighthearted response reflects his ability to handle controversy with humor.

title: 'I'll bowl at 150-160 km/h and show them': Pakistan pacer 'boycotts and retires' from PSL after draft pick snub - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pakistan Pacer Ihsanullah Retires from PSL After Draft Snub

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

After being overlooked in the PSL 10 draft, Ihsanullah announces a permanent boycott of the tournament and vows to focus on domestic cricket, aiming to prove his bowling capabilities at speeds of 150-160 km/h.

  • Ihsanullah found no takers during the PSL 10 draft, leading to his retirement from the league.
  • He emphasized that his decision was calculated rather than an emotional reaction.
  • The fast bowler plans to showcase his skills in domestic matches to make a comeback.
  • His former team's owner expressed concern about his ability to return to high speeds following an elbow injury.
“I just don’t want to play franchise cricket anymore. It’s over after today. I completely boycott it and retire from the PSL.”

This move marks a significant shift in Ihsanullah's career as he aims to reclaim his position as a top bowler in Pakistan cricket.
newTitle: Pakistan Pacer Ihsanullah Retires from PSL After Draft Snub

title: King helps Australia extend victorious run - Cricbuzz
summary:
King helps Australia extend victorious run

Date: Tue, Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Cricbuzz

Alana King inspired Australia to a thrilling 21-run victory in a low-scoring thriller against England at the Junction Oval in Melbourne, extending their Ashes lead to 4-0.

  • Australia batted first, scoring 180 runs, led by Ellyse Perry's 60 runs.
  • The English bowling attack restricted Australia with Alice Capsey taking key wickets.
  • In response, England was bowled out for 159 runs, with Alana King taking 4 for 25.
  • A dramatic batting collapse occurred on both sides, showcasing strong bowling performances.
  • Amy Jones was the top scorer for England with 47 runs, but the tailenders couldn't withstand the pressure.
"Australia's collapse from 131/2 to 180 all out gave England momentum, but Alana King's late breakthrough secured the win."

This match not only highlights the struggles both teams faced with batting collapses but also underlines the resilience of the Australian side led by King’s remarkable bowling performance.
newTitle: Alana King's Performance Secures Victory for Australia in Women's Ashes 2025

title: Virat Kohli should take a leaf out of Mumbai cricketers and play for Delhi in domestic cricket: DDCA secretary - The Indian Express
summary:
Virat Kohli should take a leaf out of Mumbai cricketers and play for Delhi in domestic cricket: DDCA secretary

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

DDCA secretary Ashok Sharma has urged Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant to participate in the Ranji Trophy. He points out a gap in the culture of participation in domestic cricket compared to Mumbai.

  • Kohli and Pant are named in the probable squad for the last rounds of the Ranji Trophy.
  • Sharma emphasizes the importance of playing for one's state team when available.
  • There are concerns regarding player fitness and participation influenced by busy schedules.
  • DDCA president Rohan Jaitley supports participation in domestic cricket for all players.
  • Kohli last played for Delhi in the Ranji Trophy in 2012.
  • Jaitley mentions that Kohli's presence could greatly impact younger players in Delhi.
“It is exceptionally important to participate in the domestic tournament. If on national duty, obviously one cannot participate, but otherwise, they should.” - Rohan Jaitley

In conclusion, engaging in domestic cricket is vital for players like Kohli and Pant, not just for performance but also for contributing to the development of future talent in the sport.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Encouraged to Play for Delhi in Domestic Cricket

title: I stood on the balcony and thought 'What just happened?': Kaun Nair, ignored by India after 303, hits doubters for a six - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karun Nair's Remarkable Comeback in the Vijay Hazare Trophy

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karun Nair's recent performances in the Vijay Hazare Trophy have been stellar, leading Vidarbha to the semi-finals. He reflects on his career struggles and emotional highs while expressing gratitude for the opportunities he has received.

  • Nair has scored multiple centuries, including five hundreds in the ongoing tournament.
  • He shared his emotional journey and hardships, emphasizing the importance of each innings.
  • Nair attributes his success this season to learning from past disappointments.
  • He hopes to make a return to the Indian national team, cherishing his past achievements, including a triple century.
Nair: "I think it was an emotional moment. It was just probably in the heat of the moment kind of post. I am usually pretty calm and composed most of the time."

Karun Nair’s resilience and outstanding form this season demonstrate his commitment and the potential for further greatness in cricket.
newTitle: Karun Nair's Remarkable Comeback in the Vijay Hazare Trophy
